name: Allinums
comment: Alliums are a family of plants which include onions, garlic, leeks, shallots, chives, and others

name: Asparagus
comment: none

name: Beans bush
comment: Lettuce, potato, tomato, other legumes, crucifers, or cucurbits increase sclerotinia in the soil and should be avoided before and after snap beans.

name: Beans pole
comment: the stalk of the corn provides a pole for the beans to grow on, which then gives nitrogen to the soil of the corn.

name: Beets
comment: Good for adding minerals to the soil through composting leaves which have up to 25% magnesium. Runner or pole beans and beets stunt each other's growth.

name: Brassicas
helpedby: Aromatic plants or plants with many blossoms, such as celery, chamomile,and marigolds
comment: Brassicas are a family of plants which includes broccoli, Brussels sprouts, cabbage, cauliflower, Chinese cabbage, kohlrabi, radish, and turnip. Thyme, nasturtiums, and onion showed good resistance to cabbage worm, weevil and cabbage looper.

name: Broccoli
helpedby: Mixture of mustard, pac choi, and rape
comment: Broccoli as a main crop intercropped with lettuce was shown to be more profitable than either crop alone.Turnip acts as a trap crop.

name: Brussels sprouts
comment: If using clover as an intercrop it should be sown after cabbage transplant so as not to affect crop yield. Nasturtiums repel cabbage moths

name: Carrot
attracts: yellow jacket and other predatory wasps
comment: Tomatoes grow better with carrots, but may stunt the carrots' growth. Beans provide the nitrogen carrots need more than some other vegetables. Aromatic companion plants repel carrot fly. Sage, rosemary, and radishes are recommended by some as companion plants, but listed by others as incompatible. Alliums inter-planted with carrots confuse onion and carrot flies. For the beneficial insect-attracting properties of carrots to work, they need to be allowed to flower; Otherwise, use the wild carrot, Queen Anne's Lace, for the same effect. Flax produces an oil that may protect root vegetables like carrots from some pests.

name: Cabbage
comment: If using clover as an intercrop it should be sown after cabbage transplant so as not to affect crop yield. Nasturtiums repel cabbage moths

name: Cauliflower
helpedby: Mixture of Chinese cabbage, marigolds, rape, and sunflower.
comment: One row of spinach alternating at 60 cm from each row of cauliflower proved mutually beneficial.

name: Celery
comment: Aster flowers, can transmit the aster yellows disease

name: Chard
comment: none

name: Corn
comment: Provides beans with a trellis, is protected from predators and dryness by cucurbits, in the three sisters technique

name: Cucumber
comment: herbs Sow two or three radish seeds in with cucumbers to repel cucumber beetles.One study showed a seventyfive percent reduction in cucumber beetles with the concurrent seeding of amaranth.Various sprays from lettuce, asparagus, Malabar spinach, and celery were found to reduce whiteflies

name: Cucurbits
comment: Cucurbits are a family of plants that includes melons, cucumbers, gourds, pumpkins, and squash

name: Eggplant or Aubergine
comment: Marigolds will deter nematodes.

name: Kohlrabi
comment: See Brassicas entry for more info

name: Leek
comment: See Alliums entry for more info

name: Legumes
comment: Rosemary and peppermint extracts are used in organic sprays for beans.Summer savory and potatoes repel bean beetles.

name: Lettuce
comment: Mints (including hyssop, sage, and various balms) repel slugs, a bane of lettuce and cabbages. Broccoli when intercropped with lettuce was shown to be more profitable then either crop alone

name: Mustard
comment: See Brassicas entry for more info. Mustard acts as a trap crop in broccoli.

name: Nightshades
comment: Nightshades are a family of plants which include tomatoes, tobacco, chili peppers (including bell peppers), potatoes, eggplant, and others

name: Okra
comment: Okra and sweet potato are mutually beneficial when planted simultaneously

name: Onion
comment: See Alliums entry for more info

name: Parsni
comment: The flowers of the parsnip plant left to seed will attract a variety of predatory insects to the garden, they are particularly helpful when left under fruit trees, the predators attacking codling moth and light brown apple moth. The root also contains Myristricin, which is toxic to fruit flies, house flies, red spider mite, pea aphids, a simple blender made extraction of three blended parsnips roots to one litre of water through a food processor (not one for preparing food) and left overnight, strained and use within a few days.

name: Peas
comment: Peas when intercropped with turnips, cauliflower, or garlic showed mutual suppression of growth however their profit per land area used was increased.

name: Peppers
comment: Pepper plants like high humidity, which can be helped along by planting with some kind of dense-leaf or ground-cover companion, like marjoram and basil; they also need direct sunlight, but their fruit can be harmed by it...pepper plants grown together, or with tomatoes, can shelter the fruit from sunlight, and raises the humidity level. Sunflowers, when in bloom at the right time, sheltered beneficial insects which lowered thrips populations

name: Potato
comment: Horseradish increases the disease resistance of potatoes. It repels the potato bug.Garlic was shown to be more effective than fungicides on late potato blight.Peas were shown to reduce the density of Colorado potato beetles.

name: Pumpkin
comment: none

name: Radish
comment: Radishes can be used as a trap crop against flea beetles. Radishes grown with lettuce taste better.

name: Soyabean
comment: A mixture of corn, mungbean, and sunflower was found to rid soybeans of aphids. Snap beans act as a trap crop for Mexican bean beetles in soybeans.

name: Spinach
comment: The peas and beans provide natural shade for the spinach. See cauliflower notes regarding mutualism with spinach.

name: Squash
comment: Radishes can be used as a trap crop against flea beetles, cucurbita can be used in the three sisters technique. Marigolds Radishes can be used as a trap crop against flea beetles, cucurbita can be used in the three sisters technique. Marigolds and nasturtiums repel squash bugs.Marigolds repel cucumber beetles

name: Sweet potato
comment: Okra and sweet potato are mutually beneficial when planted simultaneously

name: Tomatoes
comment: Black walnuts inhibit tomato growth, in fact they are negative allelopathic to all other nightshade plants (chili pepper, potato, tobacco, petunia) as well, because it produces a chemical called juglone. Dill attracts tomato hornworm. Growing tomatoes with Basil does not appear to enhance tomato flavour but studies have shown that growing them around ten inches apart can increase the yield of tomatoes by about twenty percent. One study shows that growing chili peppers near tomatoes in greenhouses increases tomato whitefly on the tomatoes

name: Turnips and rutabags
comment: Turnips act as a trap crop for broccoli. See peas regarding their mutualism with turnips

name: Apricot
comment: A fungus that peppers are prone to can infect apricot trees causing a lot of harm.

name: Blueberries
comment: Pine and oak trees create the acidic soil blueberries need. Strawberries and dewberries create healthy ground cover, clover fixes nitrogen for the blueberries' high needs, yarrow and bay laurel repel unhealthy insects. Each of the herbal companions listed also like the acidic soil the blueberry plant needs

name: Fruit trees
comment: none

name: Grapes
comment: none

name: Melon
comment: none

name: Passion fruit
comment: none

name: Pears
comment: none

name: Strawberries
avoid: Verticillium-susceptible species (tomatoes, potatoes, eggplant, peppers, melons, okra, mint, bush or bramble fruits, stone fruits, chrysanthemums, roses)
comment: Thyme planted and/or placed next to each other help grow more strawberries quickly.

name: Anise
comment: Not to be confused with star anise which is an entirely different species.

name: Basil
comment: Is said to make tomatoes taste better, chamomile and anise are supposed to increase the essential oils in many herbs like basil

name: Borage
helps: Almost everything, especially beans,strawberry,cucurbits (cucumber, squash, fruit trees,tomatoes and cabbage
comment: Predict a square metre for its adult size. Borage is a good companion for a wide variety of plants

name: Caraway
comment: none

name: Catnip
comment: none

name: Chamomile
comment: Growing near herbs will increase their oil production.

name: Chervil
comment: Loves shade, fortunately it grows well with shade-tolerant food plants; will make radishes grown near it taste spicier

name: Chives
comment: none

name: Cilantro
comment: none

name: Dill
comment: One of the few plants said to grow with fennel.

name: Fennel
comment: Fennel is allelopathic to most garden plants, inhibiting growth, causing to bolt, or actually killing many plants.When growing together a higher ratio of fennel to dill provides the highest profit. Dill has a stabilizing effect on the fennel seed. Because it attracts syrphidae it reduces aphids through predation.

name: Flax
comment: Flax contains tannin and linseed oils which may offend the Colorado potato bug

name: Garlic
comment: see Alliums entry for more info. Peas and garlic when planted closely together suppress each other's growth; however the profit over land area used is higher.Tarragon makes garlic grow rapidly.

name: Hyssop
comment: Stimulates growth of grapes.

name: Lavender
comment: none

name: Lemon grass
comment: Has been shown to reduce cutworms in eggplant in laboratory trials but needs field testing

name: Lovage
comment: Is thought to improve the health of almost all plants, like borage and geraniums, is considered a magic bullet of companion planting

name: Oregano
comment: Provides ground cover and much-needed humidity for pepper plants if allowed to spread among them. Because it attracts syrphidae, it reduces aphids through predation.

name: Parsley
comment: Sacrificially attractsinsectsthat feed on tomatoes

name: Peppermint
comment: Repels cabbage flies, has same general companion properties as other mints

name: Rosemary
comment: Deters cabbage flies, repels many bean parasites

name: Sage
avoid: Avoid any member of the allium family and common rue
comment: none

name: Southernwood
comment: Controls cabbage moths and malaria mosquitoes.

name: Spearmint
comment: Controls ants and aphids, has same general companion properties as other mints

name: Stinging nettle
comment: none

name: Summer savoury
comment: Also delays germination of certain foul herbs

name: Tarragon
comment: Its scent is disliked by most pests, and this plant is also thought to have Nurse Plant properties, enhancing the growth and flavor of crops grown with it.

name: Thyme
comment: Because it attracts syrphidae it reduces aphids through predation

name: Wormwood
comment: Wormwood should be used with caution around most vegetables since it does contain toxins

name: Yarrow
comment: May increase the essential oil production of some herbs. Also improves soil quality, use the leaves to enrich compost, or as mulch. Because it attracts syrphidae it reduces aphids through predation

name: Alyssum
comment: Because they attract syrphidae they help reduce aphids through predation.

name: Baby's breath
comment: Because they attract syrphidae they help reduce aphids through predation.

name: Bee balm
comment: none

name: Californian poppy
comment: Because they attract syrphidae they help reduce aphids through predation.

name: Dianthus
comment: none

name: Geraniums
comment: A trap crop, attracting pests away from roses and grape vines, distracts beet leafhoppers, carrier of the curly top virus, keep away from solanaceous plants like eggplant, and tobacco

name: Larkspur
comment: none

name: Lupin
comment: This wildflower is a legume, hosting bacteria that fixes nitrogen in the soil, fertilizing it for neighboring plants. Same with marigold, planting nearby roses causes them to grow vigorously.

name: Marigold
helps: Most plants, especially tomatoes[12] and peppers, cucurbits (cucumbers, gourds, squash, potatoes, roses, alliums, brassicas, zucchini
comment: Marigolds are a wonder-drug of the companion plant world, invoking the saying plant them everywhere in your garden. French marigolds (T. patula) produce a pesticidal chemical from their roots, so strong it lasts years after they are gone. Mexican marigolds (T. erecta) do the same, but are so strong they will inhibit the growth of some more tender herbs. Stinking Roger (T. minuta) has also been found effective against certain perennial weeds.[83] Same with lupin, planting nearby roses causes them to grow vigorously.

name: Nasturtium
comment: Trap crops for aphids, is among the best at attracting predatory insects, deters many pests of cucurbits

name: Pansy
comment: A good and nice-smelling flower that really attracts ants. It is like the viola plant, but has two or three colors in flowers. Helps alliums and onions, which repels the white butterfly

name: Petunia
comment: Is a trap crop almost identical to geraniums in function

name: Phacelia
helps: Plants which are prone to aphids, especially lettuce, tomato, rose
comment: This plant attracts hoverflies and is good around plants which are prone to aphids

name: Rose
comment: none

name: Sunflower
comment: Was grown as a companion for corn (maize) before modern Europeans arrived in the Americas, supposedly increases their production, ants herd aphids onto sunflowers, keeping them off neighboring plants. Works as a trap plant for thrips keeping them off of bell peppers.Planting near swan plants help sunflowers grow rapidly.

name: Swan plant
comment: Attracts the monarch butterfly during spring and summer. Basil repels pests that attracts by the swan plant like aphids.

name: Sweet pea
comment: An annual climbing plant, which is like the edible pea. Makes a good decoration in your garden or fence.

name: Tansy
helps: raspberries and relatives, roses, corn, fruit trees
comment: Toxic to people and many animals, don't plant it where livestock browse. Is reputed to generally repel insects (except for nectar-eating types)

name: Zinnia
comment: Attracts hummingbirds that eat whiteflies, attracts pollinators

name: Alfalfa
comment: Used by farmers to reduce cotton pests, a good crop to improve soil; fixes nitrogen like beans do. Also breaks up hardpan and other tough soil. Alfalfa has demonstrated some allelopathic effects to tomato seedlings

name: Peanut
comment: Peanuts encourage growth of corn and squash

name: Walnut tree
helps: Many types of grass including Kentucky bluegrass (Poa pratensis)
comment: Black walnut is harmful to the growth of all nightshade plants, including Datura or Jimson weed, eggplant, mandrake, deadly nightshade or belladonna, capsicum (paprika, chile pepper), potato, tomato, and petunia.

name: Apple
avoid: Cedar because of apple-cedar rust. Walnut because its roots produce growth inhibitors that apple trees are sensitive to
comment: none
